cpcivm_addedit_image_windows_change: When you create a server, you can choose between a Linux system, a Windows system (licence included) or an existing snapshot. During re-installation, you must choose a snapshot or a distribution of the same type.
cpcivm_addedit_image_disabled_NOT_ENOUGH: There is not enough disk space on the selected range.
cpcivm_addedit_image_windows_incompatibi: Windows is not available with VPS.
cpcivm_addedit_image_application_warning: Important information: OVH only makes sure that the application has been installed. Any management or maintenance must be done by you.
cpcivm_addedit_image_recommended_none: No specific distribution is recommended for this model
cpcivm_addedit_image_error: Oops! We were unable to find the images.
cpcivm_addedit_snapshot_cannot_delete_in: You cannot delete a snapshot if it has been installed on at least one server.
cpcivm_addedit_region_error: Oops! We were unable to find your regions.
cpcivm_addedit_region_snapshot_change: Please note that the currently selected snapshot may only be used in its current location. It may therefore not be used if its location changes.
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_vps_old:
VPS:
Public Cloud for the best price
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_vps_info_old: VPS SSD use a shared local SSD RAID and their performance may vary over time
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_vps_info_new: They are ideal for your tests and development environments. Their performance could slightly vary over time.
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_safe_info: These virtual servers are based on a CEPH disk using triple data replication and we provide guaranteed resources (CPU, RAM, network).
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_other_old:
EG, SP and HG instances:
consistent performance guaranteed
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_other_info_old: Resources (CPU, RAM, Network) are guaranteed. Each model is available with a CEPH storage (replicated 3 times) or SSD (local).
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_other_new:
CPU, RAM and general usage instances
consistent performance guaranteed
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_other_info_new: Resources (CPU, RAM, Network) are guaranteed. Each model is available with a CEPH storage (replicated 3 times) or SSD (local).
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_fast:
Guaranteed performance
and local SSD storage (no raid)
cpcivm_addedit_flavor_fast_info: These virtual servers use a non-redundant local SSD drive, providing extremely low latency. Resources (CPU, RAM, network) are guaranteed
cpcivm_addedit_table_core_details: {{ vCores }} vCores x {{ frequency }} Ghz
cpcivm_addedit_table_core_pick: Select according to the number of vCores
cpcivm_addedit_table_flex_details: Checking this option opts for 50 GB storage, providing faster snapshots and the ability to downgrade later on.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_add_submit_error: Oops! Unable to add this key.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_add_error_required: You need to name your key.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_add_error_max_char: The name must not exceed 25 characters.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_add_error_pattern_: The key name may only contain figures, lower- and upper-case letters, and hyphens ( - ), underscores ( _ ) and spaces.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_add_error_required: You have forgotten to enter your key name.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_add_submit_name_er: This name is already used for another SSH key.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_delete_success: This key is no longer available.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_delete_error: Oops! We were unable to delete this key.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_empty: You have not yet added an SSH key.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_empty_add: Click on "Add a key" to fix it!
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_error: Oops! Unable to retrieve the list of your SSH keys.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_none: You do not have an SSH key.
cpcivm_addedit_ssh_key_explain_1: OVH uses SSH to secure encrypted data communications between servers.
cpcivm_addedit_ssh_key_explain_2: There are SSH clients for each operating system. Please see the guide on creating SSH keys for more information.
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_guide: Guide on creating SSH keys
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_help_linuxmac_para: Before you generate a pair of SSH keys, make sure you do not have one already.

If you see two files named {{rsapriv}} and {{rsapub}}, you already have SSH keys and may ignore this step. The files may also be called {{dsapriv}} and {{dsapub}}, depending on the encryption algorithm used.
To generate a pair of keys, use the following command:

You will be asked: where you want to register the keys (the default value is recommended) and for a passphrase. This passphrase is not mandatory but recommended, because it adds an extra security layer for if and when someone tries to access your computer.
{{dirrsapub}} is the public key that will be on remote servers
cpcivm_addedit_sshkey_help_window_paragr: In Windows, you can generate SSH keys with the PuTTYgen application
Download and then install it. Click on Generate then wave your mouse over the window section to generate random data to create a truly random key.
Once your SSH key has been generated, copy the public key into a file. Save the private key to your computer; you will need it to connect to your servers.
cpcivm_addedit_advanced_options_descript: Multi-creation, scripts, private networks and affinity

cpcivm_edit_vm_post_error_overquota: Your current quota is preventing you from adding this type of machine. Contact your local support team to increase the quota.
cpcivm_add_vm_login_info_linux:
After creating the machine, to connect, open an SSH terminal and enter the following command:
ssh admin@{{ip}}
cpcivm_add_vm_login_info_windows:
After creating the machine, connect to it via your preferred RDP client, for example via a Linux terminal:
rdesktop {{ip}}
